H0.text: Telescope is the best tool to use when studying small organisms not visible to the eye.

H1.text: A hand lens is the best tool to use when studying small organisms that are not visible to the eye.

H2.text: Microscope is the best tool to use when studying small organisms not visible to the eye.

H3.text: Magnifying glass is the best tool to use when studying small organisms not visible to the eye.

A4.text: Microscopy is the science of investigating small objects and structures using a microscope.

A5.text: Van Leeuwenhoek re-discovered red blood cells (after Jan Swammerdam) and spermatozoa, and helped popularise the use of microscopes to view biological ultrastructure.
